lexUnit.name: scoot.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: move quickly with a rapid, darting motion

sentence.text: Shaking with terror , Isabel put a hand to the wall in an attempt to hold on to something solid , only to have it scoot across the slimy surface , almost throwing her to the ground .
The ball scooted into her goal for the ninth time , and Nick whooped with delight .
Cars moved sluggishly while pedestrians , and , of course , Italy 's omnipresent motos , scooted past them .
Thérèse scooted through breakfast to give herself time for everything she had to do .
Hoomey scooted to his feet , but several interested parties moved in to deal with Jazz before he could make a tactful retreat .
Finally we asked very loudly if the store was going broke and somebody within earshot scooted out of a doorway to see what the ruckus was about .
Creed took time only to pick up the Nikon that had fallen from the actor 's grasp before scooting for the jeep .
E.S.B. was dead tired and Dave Dick had accepted that he would not win , for Devon Loch was scooting along , increasing his lead and certain to land a famous and hugely popular victory .

Ben scooted along the rows of benches , Indiana Jones fleeing from hundreds -- no , thousands -- of screaming Arabs , ready to turn and whip swords from the hands of any who got too close , his imaginary bull-whip settled comfortably over his left shoulder and no weight at all .
Scooting down the side-aisle , she ducked past him and out of the shop , where she continued to run blindly until she was caught up against a solid chest .
Fortunately the protection is perfect , so if you do scoot off your flight should be a short one .
You can scoot off now , " cried the little man .
As she leaves , the bad old lad scoots over to intercept .
Most vans around here scoot straight through .
She stared up into his blue eyes , trying to conquer the urge to scoot further up the bed .
Lucy scooted back to Wardrobe , dived into the chair , and fumbled with the gown to get it tied .
We make the most of this and scoot off to the hospital .
They 'll scoot off to the Lake District and search round for days . "

We came out from church at about quarter-past ten and I would scoot home , for it was my job to take a can of tea and hot-cross buns ( they were really hot ) down to Dad already hard at work in the allotment .
` I 'd better scoot then , " she said .
` Since Tweed appears to have scooted , are you sending out a general alert , setting the hounds after him ? "
` Merci beaucoup , mon ami , " I 'd reply and off he 'd scoot , giggling merrily .
